values:
JANUARY
1. did you have a new year's resolution this year?: probably not, last december was not my happiest month.
2. who kissed you at midnight?: nobody
3. did it snow where you live?: of course, it never stops
4. do you like hot chocolate?: yes, of course, only my weird boyfriend doesnt like hot chocolate (taking notes amber?)
5. have you ever been to times square to watch the ball drop?: never. I want to some year though

FEBRUARY
1. who was your valentine?: nobody
2. what did your valentine get you?: did I mention i was ALONE?
3. when you were little, did you buy valentines for your whole class?: of course, little ones with disney princess on them. so much fun. and what is meant by the past tense, I still buy them!!

MARCH
1. are you irish?: no,  i dont think so at least
2. did you wear green on st. patty's day?: prolly not
3. what did you do for st. patty's day?: nothing special


APRIL
1. do you like the rain?: yes. nothing better than walking in the rain when it is warm and nice and yaaaaaaay
2. did you play an April fool's joke on anyone this year?: nope
3. did you get tons of candy on easter?: yup! even though I'm jewish my parents feel bad and send me candy!

MAY
1. what's your favorite kind of flower?: lilacs and roses and tulips
2. do you like the spring?: YES! it means softball season and sunny days and green grass
3. finish the phrase: april showers bring may flowers, what do may flowers bring?: PILGRIMS!!!
4. what would you think of as a spring color?: pastel yellow

JUNE
1. what year did you graduate from school?: 2003
2. did you go on any vacations last june?: umm. not really, I moved to DC for the summer, does that count?

JULY
1. what did you do on the 4th of july?: went to downtown Washington, walked around, hung out and watched the fireworks from the Capital
2. did you go on any vacations during this month?: nope, I was in DC!!!

AUGUST
1. did you do anything special to end off your summer?: well I went to China :) that was interesting...and fun....and scary
2. what was your favorite summer memory of '05?: the weekend that Matt came to visit me in DC...
3. did you go swimming a lot in the summer?: not as much as I wanted to
4. did you go to the beach a lot?: not really. the pool is where it is at in DC

SEPTEMBER
1. did you attend school/college in '05?: yup
2. who is/was your favorite teacher?: my govt professor
3. did you like fall better than summer?: yes, its been amazing being able to see Matt every day. and enjoy my classes. and have great friends. and just be so so so happy
OCTOBER
1. what was your favorite halloween costume ever?: ummm. i dont do costumes
2. what's your favorite candy?: twizzlers or peach rings
3. what did you dress up like this year?: didnt dress up.

NOVEMBER
1. whose house did you go to for thanksgiving?: my grandmas house at the Cape
2. do you like stuffing?: yuuuuuuuuummy
3. what are you thankful for?: family, friends, Matt, my life...
DECEMBER
1. do you celebrate christmas?: yes
2. have you ever been kissed under mistletoe?: not yet...
3. what do you want this year for christmas?: more happiness
4. what's the best present you ever got for christmas?: not sure
5. do you like cold weather?: yes, in small doses it is fine :)

Classical Political Theory exam Weds 9am
Organic Chemistry exam Weds 12:30pm
American Presidency exam Thurs 3:30pm
Physics exam Friday 9am

wish it was friday at noon,...

well...i dunno, havent updated forever. Its been quite a crazy ride, and I didn't really feel like updating in the middle of the semester, but here goes as tomorrow is the past day of classes...

1. I have three classes left between me and the end of the semester. Well, technically I also have 4 in-class exams in 72 hours, but thats just details I guess. It's been a pretty good semester for me, I've done pretty decently academically, managed to have some fun, and managed to stay sane.

2. I've been having some health issues lately. It turns out that it looks like there is nothing too serious, thankfully, but it was pretty scary for a while. Actually it still is. i'm trying not to flip out...drs apt tomorrow...Still not sure exactly what is going on, but hopefully with some more tests the doctors will have it figured out and get me back working out (not working out is driving me insane). I'll just be happy to not be dizzy and feel awful half of the day...

3. Life is overall, pretty amazing. Matt is great and I'm so happy with everything relating to that. Still, I just wish that I could have ONE SEMESTER on campus being healthy and all.

4. Being a junior isnt THAT scary, but dating a senior and having mostly senior friends sure as hell is. Also scary? taking the MCATS this spring. while taking classes. while captaining softball. lets see just how good I am at keeping my stuff together.

i think that is it for now, I feel bad that i neever put anything in here, but theres just been so much going on....

love, me

midterm week sucks.

This one actually hasn't been awful in comparison to those that I've had in the past and those I will have in...say...a few weeks.

Ochem monday, Political Theory paper wednesday, Physics exam tonight.

Then lab tomorrow 1-5, then its fall break.

Not super exciting, cause I'm just staying here, trying to get a good chunk of research done on my paper for American Presidency so I don't freak out in a few weeks.

Matt is staying for break too, which should be really nice :)

I'm happy. my life is amazing.

<3

well classes start tomorrow....

camp colby offically ends tonight, which is sad.

i dont know what is going on with my life, im scared that i've found what i want but am just going to have it dissapear.

must. be. smart.
must. not. fuck. up.

i love you all
<3 Miki

I'm in Hong Kong!

Just an update to say that 15 hour flights suck.

And that if you want a postcard, leave your address.


xoxo
Miki

Things here are really good.

Work is SO busy, I love the hill and DC. I think that I could really see myself ending up here.

Who knows anymore though, whether its medicine or politics, I just want to be happy with what I do and find something that I love.

I'm so happy with my life,

Love!

I'm a completely odd mess of emotions right now. I don't even know where to start with how I feel, so I wont. 

Tired, confused, happy, satisfied, lonly...I have no idea what I should be right now.

All I know is this is what I am, and I can't do anything but try to appreciate it for what it is.

xoxo

Hey!

I'm awful at updating, I'm so sorry, cause my life is so much fun and so interesting right now. I promise to get much better IMMEDIATLY, cause y'all deserve to share this happy thing that I've got going on.

I've been in DC for 2 weeks, and am just home to see Tory graduate before heading back to the most amazing city in the world.

1. Work is amazing. I love the Senate. I love John Kerry. I love Washington. I don't think that I could be any happier with how things are going, because this is exactly what I wanted. Words can't describe how happy I am.

2. I think I might have found someone. He makes me so incredibly happy. Thats it. 

3. I'm so gosh darn happy!!!

Love you all.
Miki

PS- friends only entry to follow shortly! Probably Sunday evening

So I'm writing this update from bed. Not my bed, but my bed for the next 8 weeks. I'm in DC! And my job starts tomorrow morning, which I am very nervous and excited for. I've changed my mind a million times on what to wear. You know that I think its a big deal when I'll actually put some make up on. Wow, I know huh?

The reason that I am in bed is two-fold. First, today was long and tiring, and we self for the airport at 4:15. Second reason is that I had a visitor last night. Needless to say, I'm soooo sleep deprived. But its all been so worth it.

Things are good. Hope they continue to look up.

:Love, Miki

Hey journal world!

I know its been a while, but I'm bored and am still craaaaaazy off the coffee that I had at Dunkins. Next time someone remind me that I cannot drink coffee so late at night. It gives me crazy dreams, makes my heart pound, and keeps me awake. Good thing about it? My caffine deprivation caused some extreme headaches, and those are gone right now.

So I'm leaving Monday AM for DC for the summer. I am so incredibly nervoud and excited. Its such a mixed bag of emotion, because it should be a great summer but I'm sad that I won't be around here to do everything that I usually do (softball, friends....) but the internship should be a great oppertunity for me to figure out if this is what I want to do with my life. Also, there are going to be a ton of fun people down there, so I can't wait for that too.

Tonight was SO MUCH FUN. I've actually had an amazing last two days. Friday I went to DS (always awkward, and usually makes me incredibly nervous and panic attack-y) and survived, and then went home and hung out until I headed to Mass for the night. I had a first date. And it went sooo well. I got home wicked late because it was so far away, but it was so worth it. Today was social day...I hung out with Tory, we went to Concord softball's last game and then to see Beauty and the Beast in Nashua. Came home and listened to the Sox win 17-1, then headed over to Ambers. Amber and I watched First Daughter (so cute!) and had a really good time catching up, and then joined Ryan, Isaac, Linds, Lins, and Julie at Dunkins for a 2 hour reunion. So much fun.

So I'm happy. I'm tired, actually exhausted. But I want to wait up for someone to get home so I can talk to him...but I don't think I'm gonna make it.

The past few days I've really realized how amazing my friends are. I'm so lucky to have everyone special to me in my life.

Really content right now.
Love, Miki

Well, here goes...

I'm done my sophmore year, which is insane because it completely flew by. I know that I was only at school for one semester, but things were just amazing. I mean, socially I had a wonderful group of friends that mainly consisted of softball girls but always had some other people thrown in for good times. Softball turned pretty well but not great. I played through mono. No guys of interest during the semester, although things are starting to look up now.

Wow. looking back on what I just wrote it seems like a crappy semester. But somehow it ended up well, and things couldnt be better now. Well minus a few small complications. But I'm happy.

I will be in DC this summer, working for Senator Kerry. Not expecting it to be an intereting summer socially. Even after all my hopes with things working out with certain people, I really don't care anymore. Which is great.

I'm happy. I'm very content with my life.

Love you all, 
Miki

unless something amazing happens: I'm done with LJ til summer.

Too much going on here

xoxo Miki

Well, I have mono.

Which means I can't play softball for the rest of the year.

Gah.

Not a good development.

Yay! I got an internship for the summer with Sen. Kerry's office in DC.


So excited.

Waiting to hear from a few more offices.

:-)

Happy Spring Break to Me.

Don't even want to talk about this week. It's over. And now it's break time :-)

Headed to Florida with the team for Spring Training. All the fun starts in 4 hours.

Hurrah


So, if you want to see how we're doing, visit http://www.colby.edu/athletics/teams/softball/0405/schedule/index.html


OR call my cell, cause I would love to hear from you.

LOVE!

not too much is new, really.

I have an insane week coming up, with three exams, the beginning of the real season, and an insane amount of work.

sounds like fun.

tonight I'm going to team dinner, maybe a little movie action and then back here to do a little bit of work before bed.

should be a fun night, after having to stay in last night because i was on duty. Oh being an hr.


Love!

back at school, jan plan break was awesome. I did a lot of sitting around and watching movies (finished the entire 2nd season of Gilmore Girls) but also managed to go hang out with Jon, and some other fun stuff too.

So classes start tomorrow, and I'm in the middle of a little flip out about this summer. I'm (hopefully) spending it in DC, but the process of finding an internship is stressing me out. I'm applying to a bunch of Senator's offices (Schumer, Clinton, Obama, Levine, Kerry, Kennedy), a few Democratic organizations, and some other assorted stuff.

The problem is that everyone wants something different. So in addition to cover letters and resume, I have to whip up some writing samples that address certain issues. It's like applying to college. All over again. But more than one application, so I'm stressed. Almost everything is due by the end of February, so the next few weeks with class and applications and softball I might just be a little busy.

Classes start tomorrow: Comparitive Government, International Relations, Organic Chemistry, and French (if they let me in).

Ugh. Dinner soon. I'm hungry.

You Are 26 Years Old
26
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?
haha. im old

Wow, a public entry.....

I talked to my advisor and the registrar about it today, and I have a choice. So this is my debate:

Option 1:
Move my graduation year back to '07, and graduate with my class
Spend this summer in DC working on the hill.
Use my AP credits to graduate on time.
Save $19,000

Option 2:
Stay an '08J which means I won't be able to graduate with my class.
Spend my summer in NH working for Gov. Lynch and possibly coaching softball.
Spend my senior fall in DC doing a semester's internship and taking classes.
Graduate without my class in '08.

There are clear positive and negatives to both of these options, but I really dont know what to do.

Any advice would be helpful.

Hello.

I'm re-entering the journal world.

Friends only from here on out, unless I forget


:-)

I will probably regret this post soon.

Too bad.

I'm pissed. I'm pissed that 87% of the 18-25 group that I am a member didnt vote. I'm mad that people didnt wait in line, I'm mad that people didnt seam to care. 

You know what? If you didnt vote, you don't have a right to complain. So just shut up.

Ok, anything else? Because if ONE MORE PERSON asks me if I regret working on the campaign I will punch them. It was the best decision I have ever made on my life. I would do it again right now. 

I had the most amazing 6 months of my life. I have never been prouder of what a group of people accomplished.

That doesn't mean I have fait in my president. I'm ashamed of what being an American means right now. I am not proud.

Oh, and if you want a "Don't blame me, I'm from New Hampshire" bumper sticker, let me know. I'm having them made.

Wake me up in four years.

I'm blaming it on George W. Bush.

damn the man.


<3

Sure, you're supposed to have total recall of who won the Battle of Hastings and what motivated Hamlet. And probably you should be able to label all five Great Lakes. Perhaps you can... perhaps it's easier to remember that first kiss. Or the time you and your friends couldn't stop laughing in math class. Or your locker combination or cafeteria mystery meat or the scent in the air when you-know-who glided past your desk... Or maybe it's easier to remember the thrill of passing the final or the fun of the last homecoming game or hugging your best friends in the world good-bye and knowing you'd be in touch forever. But still, wondering... just a little... will we always remember? 


*sigh*

yes. yes i will.

sigh

more later

So its finally friday.

This week was interesting, and the past two days in particular have been incredibly intense. With the DNC coming up next week, I've been flat out scheduling interviews for all of the delegates. It's been a trial by fire, but I still love what I'm doing. Work is great. I really feel like I'm making a difference and I'm learning so much about John Kerry and politics that it is perfect. I don't think that I'm on a fast track to switching my major to poly sci, but its interesting that I found something that I love so much that has nothing to do with my major.

In other news, softball is going well. We have a tourny down in Lowell this weekend, then Gilford, and then Penn. After that its ankle surgery time (Aug 11) and then my job becomes 24/7.

Well i've got to run, since is 9am, and I have to catch the morning radio hosts right after they get off the air.

Love, Miki

So it is nice to be home. Strange that everything has stayed the same while everything around me at college was constantly changing and evolving, but I'll get used to it, and catch up to what is happening. It's been a while since I wrote a decent entry, with the stress and insanity of my last week at Colby to the first few days back at home. So...

-Before Sunday: I don't even want to talk about exam week, but to say that I worked insanely hard, put in 70+ hours of studying, took caffine pills (bad idea) and just put everything I had into my four exams. What else can I do? No matter what I end up getting in all of my classes, I am still proud of myself. Whew. 
-Sunday: Packed up all of my stuff on Sunday afternoon and headed home with dad. Somehow I managed to accumulate a ton more things over the school year, so packing was a process, as was the reaction my allergies like to have to the dust in my room.Lots of sad goodbyes. One of the worst was Ry, who I realized I wont see for 15 months. Sad. And of course, Adam, Care, and Sarah. :-( Got home and before I even got home stopped at my HS softball field to watch a catching clinic. Saw my sister, saw some friends, then home. Collapsed. So nice to be home :-)

-Monday: Slept until 11. Hey, I deserve it. Unpacket a little, cleaned up a little. Headed to my sister's game in Thayer to watch her make me proud. It was a blast even though it ended up being 13-0. Fun, Fun. At night I headed over to Gatzke's to chill and watch movies. Ended up seeing lots of fun people there, and REUNION WITH AMBER!!! Amber and I decided we couldnt sit in a room and not talk, so we went back to her house and talked for a while, followed by a bit of footloose. 

-Tuesday: Job Search Day. Went and filled out a bunch of apps, actually had a job interview at American Eagle at 3. Hope I get that because it has great discounts, and that is pretty much the only place I buy clothes. Went to the gym, joined up again and started the summer madness. Its so great to start getting back in shape, after you get past that period of pain. Right now I am still dealing with the pain. Tuesday night I didn't do anything, just hung out here with the family, sorted summer ball uniforms. 

-Wednesday: Woke up kinda early and cleaned and unpacked, interupted by lots of tv and music breaks. Got a lot accomplished. Headed to Boston with my dad to see my ankle doctor, and he said that I needed surgery, which is not really a suprise considering that I had been told this before and had decided to play through it for the rest of my spring season. So I got scheduled for Aug. 11th. That should be a blast, considering I wont be able to drive for 3 months, that I will be on crutches for the first few months and all. I'm pumped. Welll, actually, I am happy I still get to play summer ball AND get this sucker fixed before next spring. SO then I got home, and had a phone message from the new head SB coach at my high school, OFFERING ME AN ASSISTANT COACHING POSITION FOR THE REST OF THE YEAR!!! So excited. I start tomorrow. SOOOOOOOOOOO HAPPY!

So now? I'm going to go downstairs and compulsivly flip between American Idol and the Bachelor...then watch Made. Wow, sometimes I feel like I am a waste of space. :-)

Love, Miki

somewhere behind the athlete you've become, the hours of practice, the great games you'll never forget, the games you wish you could, the coaches who pushed you, the teamates who believed in you, and the fans who cheered for you, is the little girl who fell in love with this game and never looked back.. play for her

and it just hit.

and im hyper.


channel this energy...channel it.

love
